author: christopheralanwest
body: This PR propagates the correction for nonlinearity of the SiPMs in the upgraded HE to the linearization LUTs used in the generation of trigger primitives. This PR should only affect MC samples that use an upgraded HE. The effect of these changes is quite small as the nonlinearity is important only at high energy. The nonlinearity corrections are only relevant below the L1 saturation E_T of 128 GeV. As multiple depths contribute to each trigger tower, this E_T of < 128 GeV is spread among multiple channels. Consequently, none of the tower constituents have an energy for which nonlinearity is important. At today's L1 trigger primitives meeting, it was demonstrated that [1] this PR: - Has a negligible effect on trigger rates - Has a negligible effect on any L1 quantities - Improves the agreement between the TP E_T and the Method 2 reconstruction The last point, from slide 6 of [1], most clearly demonstrates the effect of this PR and is reproduced below. [1] https://indico.cern.ch/event/678785/contributions/2780378/attachments/1553502/2442798/07NOV2017_cawest.pdf
title: Implement HCAL SiPM nonlinearity in LUTs
